article: It was only in the eighteenth century that people Europe began to think mountains were beautiful . _ that time, mountains were _ by the people living on the plains, _ by the city people, to whom they were wild and _ places in which one was easily lost or killed by terrible animals. Slowly ,however , many of the people who were living _ in the towns began to grow tired of _ . They began to feel interested in looking for things that could not be explained , for sights and sounds which produce a feeling of fear and excitement . _ in the _ century, people began to turn away from the man-made _ to the untouched country, and particulary _ a place where it was dangerous and wild. High mountains began to be _ for a holiday. Then , mountain-climbing began to grow popular as a sport. To some people ,there is something greatly _ about getting to the _ of a hight mountain . Struggling against nature is finer than a battle _ other human beings. And then, when you are at the mountain top after a long and difficult _ , what a _ reward it is to be able to look _ on everything within _ ! At such time, you feel happier and prouder than you can ever feel down _ .
